title: C.H. Robinson CFO Andrew Clarke to Leave
summary: Leadership shuffle continues at freight broker. A leadership shuffle at C.H. Robinson Worldwide Inc. continued Thursday, with the announced departure of the company's chief financial officer.

title: Critics Worry Trump's Free Speech Order Could Limit Expression, Research
summary: Some in academia voice concerns that campus speech directive could hamper students', researchers' activities. WASHINGTON-President Trump put colleges and universities on notice Thursday that they could lose federal funding if they don't protect free speech, addressing a longstanding complaint of conservatives but sparking concerns the move could wind up squelching free expression instead.

title: Bond Yields, Bank Stocks Sink as Cautious Fed Worries Investors
summary: Investors punish bank shares as the yield curve flattens. Benchmark Treasury yields touched fresh 2019 intraday lows Thursday, a sign the Federal Reserve's caution has boosted investors' worries about the outlook for the global economy.

title: MTA Picks Consultant to Oversee L Train Tunnel Repair
summary: Some board members are frustrated that the consultant won't assess a revised plan before the main phase of construction begins next month. The Metropolitan Transportation Authority will ask its board to approve a $1.2 million contract next week for a consultant to oversee reconstruction work on the L train tunnel under the East River, according to an authority spokesman.

title: Forums Planned on Diversity Fix at Specialized Schools
summary: Push follows release of data underscoring chronic racial imbalances at the eight high schools. Saying Mayor Bill de Blasio's proposal to diversify New York City's specialized high schools was going nowhere, four Democratic state senators announced plans Thursday to host community forums this spring to hear public input on the admissions system.

title: Thailand's Dictator-Democrats
summary: A tainted electoral process risks more political discord.. Thailand will hold its first national election since 2011 on Sunday, but hold the champagne. Bangkok's ruling military junta has rigged the process to minimize the chance of a transfer of power, and the resulting hybrid authoritarianism may not satisfy millions of Thais who want an alternative.

title: Trump and the College Censors
summary: He nails the problem, but federal coercion isn't the solution.. President Trump jumped into the debate over free speech on campus on Thursday, signing an executive order that seeks to protect students from the rampant "censorship and coercion" on campus. As is often the case with government, the intentions are better than the solution.

title: The SEC Sideswipes VW
summary: The agency shoots the wounded with a dubious enforcement theory.. More than two years ago Volkswagen paid $23 billion to settle claims that it cheated on emissions tests. Yet the Securities and Exchange Commission is now suing the German auto maker for failing to disclose the deceit that most in the company didn't know about and didn't harm bond investors. Has Elizabeth Warren hijacked the commission?

title: A European Rebuke for Orban
summary: The Continent's center-right finally stands up to Hungary's autocrat.. Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban for years has refused to abide by the political values of the European Union. On Wednesday he finally paid a price when his Fidesz party was suspended from the European Parliament's center-right bloc.

title: Israel's Golan Heights
summary: U.S. recognition of Israeli sovereignty sees the Middle East as it is.. President Trump made new U.S. policy on Thursday, as he often does these days, with a tweet recognizing Israel's sovereignty over the Golan Heights on the border with Syria. This time his tweet was based on more than personal impulse and makes sense for American and Israeli interests.

title: Former Brazilian President Temer Arrested in Corruption Probe
summary: Long-running graft investigation has led to the jailing of scores of high-profile businessmen and politicians. SÃO PAULO-Brazil's former President Michel Temer has been arrested in the latest breakthrough in the Car Wash investigation, sending shock waves through Congress as the country struggles to move on from the five-year-long corruption scandal.

title: EU Agrees to Short Brexit Delay
summary: U.K. could still crash out of the bloc if it doesn't agree to exit deal by mid-April. BRUSSELS-European leaders allowed Prime Minister Theresa May to postpone the Brexit deadline beyond next week, but warned the U.K. could still crash out of the trade bloc in mid-April unless the British political stalemate over the withdrawal agreement was broken.

title: Congress's Mean Girls Are Trump's Offspring
summary: Omar and Ocasio-Cortez equate roughness with authenticity. So does the man they despise.. We're in a time of absorbed but subtle and not fully noticed shifts. Old-time liberals and conservatives seem to understand each other more deeply, more generously than they did in the past: In some new way they see the other's basic political decency. On the other hand the parties they've been aligned with offer constant confusion and surprise.

title: Levi Strauss Shares Surge 32% in Debut
summary: Long-established, profitable Levi isn't the typical hot IPO except in one way: dual-class shares. Shares of famed jeans maker Levi Strauss & Co. vaulted 32% in their first day of trading Thursday, the latest sign of a burgeoning IPO market that is on pace to be one of the best ever.

title: Trump Backs Israeli Sovereignty Over Golan Heights
summary: President says long-disputed region is of critical strategic and security importance to Israel, marking what would be a major policy shift. President Trump endorsed Israeli sovereignty over the Golan Heights on Thursday, marking what would be a sharp U.S. policy shift over the disputed territory decades after Israel seized the land from Syria in the Six Day War.

title: What FBI's Counsel Told Congress
summary: Baker's testimony shows Comey wasn't being fully candid about the dossier.. One problem with the Trump-Russia investigation is that the facts continue to be released in dribs and drabs. The unreleased House transcript of the testimony of James Baker, former general counsel of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, is Exhibit A for why it is so crucial for Americans to get full documentation, and soon.

title: A Day of Rest May Get a Day in Court
summary: The justices could undo a 1977 decision that gutted workers' religious protections.. The Supreme Court inched closer this week to undoing a decades-old mistake that has denied meaningful workplace protections for religious employees. On Monday the high court asked the solicitor general to outline the government's view in Patterson v. Walgreen, a case under consideration for a full hearing.

title: Why Do Americans Care About Israel?
summary: To understand, look to Aipac's Policy Conference.. Anti-Semites on the hard right and the hard left love to decry the power of the "Jewish lobby." In one sense they're right. Israel does exert a profound pull on the American soul. The two nations share deep commonalities, interests and profound respect. The American Israel Public Affairs Committee, or Aipac, gains its strength not only from Jewish support, but also from the scores of millions of gentile Americans who cherish these bonds.

title: 'Totally Wired' Review: Social Media's Patient Zero
summary: Josh Harris's short-lived Pseudo.com anticipated networks like YouTube and Snapchat. But users weren't ready yet.. The dot-com boom and bust of the late 1990s and early 2000s is often thought of as an era marked by irrational market exuberance over internet companies that did not, in fact, produce anything valuable or profitable-and in some ways, that is what the era was. But in New York the most fascinating aspect of the period had nothing to do with business: It was the barrage of dreamers and artists who descended on the city. They were all convinced that there was going to be a tectonic shift in technology, communications and American culture, and they all wanted to influence it. They were, in a way, Generation-X gold-panners, heading to "Silicon Alley" in order to, as Andrew Smith puts it in his book "Totally Wired," become "part of a collective drift into the imagination."

title: I Want to Be Investigated by the FBI
summary: In the age of #MeToo, a claim of innocence-even a provable one-is itself treated as an offense.. If you are accused of a crime, you are entitled to the presumption of innocence. But in the age of #MeToo, people accused of sexual misconduct are subjected, at least in the court of public opinion, to a presumption of guilt. Worse, a claim of innocence-even a provable one-is itself treated as an offense, an assault on the accuser and on "survivors" in general.

title: Medicare's Hospice Rules Could Make Your Doctor a Criminal
summary: If he says you have six months to live and you survive longer, has he committed fraud?. A doctor concludes that an elderly patient has less than six months to live. A second doctor disagrees. One of the predictions will be wrong. But was it false?

title: China Oppresses Muslims at Home, Countenances Terror Abroad
summary: Beijing vetoes sanctions on a Pakistani jihadist, while subjecting Uighurs to unspeakable brutality.. China's attitude toward Islam is a gobsmacking double standard. At home, Beijing persecutes members of the Uighur minority for practicing their faith. Overseas, China supports Masood Azhar, a hardened jihadist condemned by the U.S. and other major democracies for fomenting terrorism against India.

title: Notable & Quotable: Jordan Peterson and the Inclusivity Paradox
summary: "Cambridge University has rescinded its offer of a visiting fellowship to Jordan Peterson.". Sarah Marshreporting for the Guardian, March 20:

title: Pinterest Pins Tech Hopes on Walmart Technology Chief
summary: Jeremy King oversaw Walmart Labs, the retail giant's innovation hub, in his role as CTO. Pinterest Inc. is tapping Walmart Inc.'s technology leader as its new head of engineering, as the online image-sharing site gears up for an expected initial public offering this year.

title: Levi CFO Returns to NYSE to Float Another Family-Owned American Icon
summary: Harmit Singh helped take Levis to market nearly a decade after he helped take Hyatt public on the same exchange. Harmit Singh, dressed entirely in denim, helped ring the opening bell at the New York Stock Exchange Thursday, marking the return of Levi Strauss & Co. to the public markets.

title: Nike Posts Quarterly Sales Gain, Says Growth Will Slow
summary: Executives say digital sales reached $1 billion in latest quarter; demand in U.S., China is strong. Nike Inc. said strong consumer demand in the U.S. and China helped the company sell more products at full price and through its own apps and websites in the holiday quarter, but it cautioned that sales growth would slow in the current quarter.

title: WarnerMedia Creates Role of Chief Diversity and Inclusion Officer
summary: New post comes after employee concerns over lack of women in company's top ranks, memo says. The chief executive of AT&T Inc.'s WarnerMedia unit said the company is creating the new role of chief diversity and inclusion officer, according to an internal memo, amid concerns among employees about the lack of women in the entertainment giant's upper ranks.

title: Treasury Department Accuses North Korea of Evading U.S. Sanctions
summary: North Korea last year imported petroleum and exported coal in violation of sanctions regulations, the department said. North Korea continues to import petroleum and export coal in defiance of U.S. and United Nations sanctions, the U.S. Treasury Department said Thursday, as nuclear negotiations between the two countries remain stalled.

title: Services Data Point to Sharper Slowdown
summary: Fourth-quarter GDP growth likely to be marked down after services survey underwhelms. WASHINGTON-Americans' spending on services slowed sharply in the fourth quarter, suggesting the economy lost more momentum at the end of 2018 than previously believed.

title: Trump Approves Disaster Declaration for Nebraska
summary: State has been facing historic flooding from rain, snow melt; early estimate of $1.4 billion in damage. The Trump administration has approved Nebraska's request for a presidential disaster declaration that will let the state tap federal funds to recover from recent devastating flooding.

title: Paulson Opposes Newmont's Merger Deal with Goldcorp
summary: Activist investor, in letter to Newmont, says current deal would transfer away significant gains from a joint venture. Paulson & Co. said Thursday it opposes Newmont Mining Corp.'s $10 billion merger with Goldcorp Inc. because it would transfer away significant gains from a recently announced Nevada joint venture.

title: Ford Names Former Amazon Veteran as Next CFO
summary: Tim Stone will succeed CFO Bob Shanks, who will retire at the end of the year. Ford Motor Co. has tapped an Amazon.com Inc. veteran as its new chief financial officer, reflecting a broader transformation at the 116-year-old auto maker as it tries to compete with Silicon Valley on new transportation technologies.

title: Ex-Treasurer of Charity for Fallen NYPD Officers Accused of Stealing $410,000
summary: Woman allegedly used the money to pay for her son's legal fees in deadly hit-and-run, Barbra Streisand tickets. The former treasurer of a charity for the families of fallen New York Police Department officers was charged with bank fraud and identity theft Thursday for allegedly stealing $410,000 from the nonprofit and using the money to pay for Barbra Streisand tickets and legal fees for her son, federal prosecutors said.

title: 'Delhi Crime' Review: Hunt for Justice
summary: A drama series about an infamous 2012 sexual assault in India and its aftermath.. In December 2012, a 23-year-old woman in Delhi, India, was victim of a crime whose impossible brutality made news around the world. It's this event that has been shaped into "Delhi Crime," a highly potent Netflix drama (Friday) whose seven parts deliver a fictionalized version of events, though one largely true to most of the essentials of the case. And this time around, the story of the sex crime committed by six assailants on a Delhi bus (the rapists confident that an Indian woman who had the temerity to be out in public as late as 9 p.m. deserved every act of depraved cruelty they could inflict on her) isn't likely to be banned in India, as happened the first time a film on the subject was made.

title: 'Wolf vs. Bear' Review: Brains, Brawn, Survival
summary: Two mighty animals use their skills in a battle for food.. Size doesn't matter is the overall judgment delivered at the end of "Wolf vs. Bear" (Wednesday, 9 p.m., Smithsonian Channel)-one of the few times that cherished belief rings true. Context, of course, does matter, and the kind the film has on its mind with regard to the size question has to do with the battle for survival between wolves and bears.

title: Debating Whether Democrats Are Socialists
summary: Alan Blinder implores Democrats to stop pretending to be socialists. Judging by their actions, they aren't pretending.. Thanks for Alan Blinder's "Democrats, Stop Pretending to Be Socialists" (op-ed, March 15), which discusses socialism, successful capitalism and the Democratic Party. I hope the Journal will take this to heart and stop attaching the word "socialist" when it mentions Democrats. To worry about creeping socialism in America is patently ridiculous and reminiscent of the paranoid 1950s when there was supposed to be a communist behind every bush.

title: It's Worth Fighting for Real Border Security
summary: President Trump may view border security as a substantive matter, not one to be addressed with an optical illusion.. Former George W. Bush Press Secretary Ari Fleischer opines that in pursuing emergency funds to build the wall President Trump will be "plagued by press coverage of every setback he suffers in pursuit of the emergency wall funding" ("Declare Victory, Not Emergency," op-ed, March 1).

title: Myriad Paper Forms Litter Bold 'Paperless' EHR World
summary: Mandated electronic health records burden physicians and, arguably, worsen patient care. But the forms patients must sign have also turned nightmarish.. Regarding the letters of March 13 ("Health Records Should Focus on the Patient"): Mandated electronic health records burden physicians and, arguably, worsen patient care. But the forms patients must sign have also turned nightmarish, not unlike the dense legalese of many financial, leasing and other user agreements meant to be signed pro forma but not really to be read and understood.

title: Consumer Group Calls for FDA Moratorium on Opioid Approvals
summary: Public Citizen warns federal agency 'culpable' in overdose crisis. The consumer group Public Citizen is calling on the Food and Drug Administration to issue a moratorium on new opioid-painkiller approvals, calling their message an "urgent request" in the name of public safety.

title: For Best Athletes, College Offers More Than School
summary: The branding and value achieved by Zion Williamson from his play this year at Duke has generated a rate of return that would be the envy of any hedge fund or entrepreneur.. In "Billion-Dollar 'Amateurs'" (Main Street, March 19), William McGurn joins a large chorus calling for reform of big-time college sports (read: men's basketball and football). The enormous pay scale of coaches, lavish facilities and the outsize growth (with attendant corruption) of the entire business leaves one feeling there must be a better way. But it's complicated.

title: Bitcoin Futures Launch Hits Regulatory Snag
summary: Intercontinental Exchange's talks with CFTC stall over regulation of bitcoin warehouse. Government concerns about cryptocurrencies have snarled a plan by the owner of the New York Stock Exchange to launch the first futures contract that would pay out in bitcoin.

title: Man Pleads Guilty to Sending Mail Bombs to Democrats, Trump Critics
summary: Cesar Savoc was arrested in Florida in October after mailbombs were sent to Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, others. The Florida man who authorities say mailed bombs to prominent critics of President Trump, leading to a five-day nationwide manhunt, pleaded guilty to 65 felonies Thursday before a federal judge in New York.

title: Judge Pushes New Sears to Resolve Dispute With Old Company
summary: Old Sears claims Eddie Lampert's new Sears still owes it millions of dollars. Edward Lampert's new Sears was pushed by a bankruptcy judge Thursday to smooth over its disagreements with the entity left behind in bankruptcy protection.

title: Top Wall Street Women Say Technology Can Help Close the Gender Gap
summary: More needs to be done to provide opportunities for advancement into most senior levels. Women face many pitfalls when trying to climb the ladder at Wall Street banks. Among them: the words managers use to describe them when they are up for promotion, a top JPMorgan Chase & Co. deal-maker said.

title: 'Us' Film Review: Double-Dealing at Its Dazzling Best
summary: Jordan Peele returns with another stunning achievement in the horror genre, this time about a vacationing family accosted by their doppelgängers.. Don't come to me for a searching exegesis of Jordan Peele's "Us," a polytonal slasher saga with more undertones, overtones, intricate themes, elusive mysteries and scary images than anyone could absorb in a single viewing. All I can tell you for now is that it's compulsory seeing for everyone who loves the horror genre, the movie medium and the notion of saying sage things about contemporary life without straying from entertainment's twisty path. The film is being marketed as having come "from the mind of Jordan Peele," a phrase that might sound pretentious for a guy who has made only one previous feature. But that debut, "Get Out," was extraordinary, and this follow-up does seem to have sprung from the scintillating synapses of a singular brain-as well as having been, to put it more mundanely, written and directed by the very same thinker. (And shot, superbly, by Mike Gioulakis.)

title: Venezuela Intelligence Police Detain Top Opposition Aide
summary: Arrest threatens to raise tensions and provoke U.S. punitive measures. Venezuela's government escalated its campaign against opposition leader Juan Guaidó as intelligence agents in ski masks arrested his top aide in a predawn raid Thursday, a move that threatens to ratchet up international pressure against authoritarian leader Nicolás Maduro.

title: 'Hotel Mumbai' Review: Suspense Over Substance
summary: This retelling of the 2008 attack on Mumbai's Taj Mahal Palace Hotel is an action thriller, and suffers for it.. 'Hotel Mumbai" is a harrowing re-creation of a horrific event, the 2008 attack on Mumbai's Taj Mahal Palace Hotel during a city-wide assault by 10 members of an Islamic terrorist group based in Pakistan. As a thriller it's efficient, if formulaic, and technically proficient, if undistinguished. Still, at this blighted moment in time, when we're besieged by reports of mass shootings and images of anguishing slaughter, how do we justify watching more of the same as entertainment unless it tells us something we didn't know? The story, a fictionalized version of the 2009 documentary "Surviving Mumbai," does remind us how vulnerable we are; not exactly a revelation, but not nothing. For the most part, though, the screen is filled by young killers with heavy weaponry on a savage rampage, and by generically suspenseful heroics that ensue-members of the hotel's staff trying to protect hundreds of guests, some of the guests trying to save their loved ones from the terrorists' gunfire and grenades.

title: Latest Experimental Alzheimer's Drug Fails Testing
summary: Drugmakers Biogen and Eisai ended studies of treatment, deeming it unlikely to benefit patients in latest research setback. The search for new Alzheimer's disease treatments hit another big setback on Thursday when drugmakers Biogen Inc. and Eisai Co. said they would terminate two late-stage studies of an experimental drug after determining it would likely fail to help patients.

title: Investors Keep Puerto Rico Bonds After First Chapter of Restructuring
summary: Troubled island's financial prospects could be turning around. Investors are hanging on to bonds issued as part of Puerto Rico's massive restructuring effort, a sign of confidence in the fiscally troubled island's prospects.

title: Rice Brothers Step Up Fight to Control EQT
summary: The pair will nominate nine directors to the natural-gas producer's 12-member board. A pair of brothers is ramping up their fight against EQT Corp. , seeking control of the board at the biggest natural-gas producer in the U.S. after selling their own company to it in 2017.

title: Bank Stocks Slump on Revived Global Growth Worries
summary: Financial shares retreat with bond yields after Federal Reserve signals caution. Bank stocks fell broadly Thursday, their second straight day of declines, after the Federal Reserve signaled caution on U.S. economic growth.

title: GameStop Names New CEO
summary: Two shareholders have threatened a proxy fight if GameStop didn't overhaul its board and take other steps to improve its performance. GameStop Corp. has named George Sherman as its next chief executive, ending a monthslong search for a candidate to lead the videogame retailer.

title: U.S. Stocks Finish Higher, Lifted by Tech Sector
summary: Gains underscore investors' willingness to snap up riskier stocks as long as Fed maintains more accommodative stance. Shares of technology companies led major U.S. indexes higher, as investors warmed up to riskier stocks following the Federal Reserve's indication that it will hold interest rates steady this year.

title: Mississippi Bill Outlaws Abortion When Heartbeat of Fetus Is Detected
summary: Republican governor signs bill that, with few exceptions, prohibits abortions as early as six weeks into pregnancy. Mississippi Republican Gov. Phil Bryant signed a bill Thursday that, with few exceptions, bans doctors from performing abortions as early as six weeks into a pregnancy.

title: Insurers and Hedge Fund Form Creditor Group in PG&E Bankruptcy
summary: Group seeks to recover billions of dollars in insurance paid out to customers. A group of insurance companies and hedge fund Baupost Group LLC have formed a creditor group to attempt recouping the billions of dollars in insurance payouts from PG&E Corp. stemming from damage caused by California wildfires, court documents show.

title: Samsung Probed U.S. Marketing Operation Over Dealings With Business Partners
summary: Company laid off number of staff amid broader realignment and executive turnover. Samsung Electronics Co. audited its U.S. marketing operation to investigate whether employees violated company policies in their dealings with business partners, resulting in layoffs of several staffers, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Best-Selling Books Week Ended March 9
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: U.S. Government Bonds Reverse Early Rally
summary: Ten-year yield briefly touches 2.499%, its lowest intraday level since January 2018. U.S. government bond prices retraced early gains Thursday, keeping yields near their lowest levels in nearly two years, a day after the Federal Reserve signaled it was unlikely to raise interest rates at all this year and might be done with its recent campaign to tighten monetary policy.

title: Oil Prices Slip After Hitting 2019 High
summary: U.S. crude prices are up 3% this week due largely to a weekly report of a sharp drop in domestic inventories. The U.S. oil market slipped on Thursday, after falling inventories and signals from the Federal Reserve earlier this week propelled prices to their highest levels of 2019.

title: U.S. Deportations Rise, but Remain Below Peak in Obama Era
summary: Number of immigrants sent out of U.S. rose 10% in last three months of 2018. WASHINGTON-The federal government deported 66,549 immigrants in the last three months of 2018, up 10% from the year-earlier period, but the figure remained far below the peak during the Obama administration, according to data released Thursday by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

title: Slowdown in Jumbo Mortgages Tests Banks' Postcrisis Playbook
summary: Loans too big for Fannie and Freddie dropped 12% last year by dollar volume. High-end home buyers are turning cautious, a blow to banks that refocused their mortgage businesses around wealthy borrowers in the years after the financial crisis.

title: Comcast Offers Web-Connected TV Service to Its Internet Customers
summary: The 'Xfinity Flex' service, which will cost $5 a month, is being rolled out next week. Comcast Corp. on Thursday unveiled a $5-a-month service for its internet-only customers that will allow access to ad-supported streaming video channels like YouTube and Cheddar, an initiative that could bring in more revenue from people who aren't subscribing to the cable giant's pay-TV service.

title: A Stress-Free Guide to Dressing for Any Wedding
summary: Whether you're headed to a destination wedding with a baffling dress code, or a simpler affair, here is an exhaustive guide to wedding-guest attire for both men and women. Sweaty men are best advised to try one of the lightweight suiting options at left, with the proviso that linen can get wrinkly if you fail to stay motionless at all times. For chilly women, there are certainly options beyond the tired pashmina. Some ideas are at right. The embroidered cape is not exactly hefty, but it adds a slight layer of warmth.

title: Gold Gets a Boost From Fed's Dovish Stance
summary: Fed signaled on Wednesday it is unlikely to raise rates further this year. Metals prices were mixed on Thursday, with the precious complex broadly boosted by the U.S. Federal Reserve's decision not to raise interest rates further this year.

title: Bank Bailouts and the Washington Post
summary: The paper's "fact checkers" adopt a novel view of government assistance.. News consumers may have a hard time choosing sides as they observe Sen. Bernie Sanders and the Washington Post offer competing narratives about the 2008 bank bailouts. But it seems likely that this week's debate will not add to public understanding of finance or the federal government's role in the era of crisis.

title: Executive Quarrel Trips Up Eyewear Giant Months After Merger
summary: EssilorLuxottica's executive chairman accuses executive vice chairman of taking unilateral decisions. PARIS-The eyewear giant that owns Ray-Ban, LensCrafters and dozens of other brands is in turmoil as a public fight broke out between top executives over control of the company, just six months after they created it in a merger of equals.

title: The Bond Market's Blind Faith in a Do-Nothing Fed
summary: Investors are ignoring the possibilities of faster inflation or a sharp economic slowdown at their peril. Just three months after an embarrassing policy reversal by the Federal Reserve, investors are now sure they understand both what the central bank has planned and what will happen to inflation and the economy. In short: Nothing much.

title: Judge Blocks Laws Limiting Powers of Wisconsin Governor
summary: Republican legislative leaders vow to appeal. MADISON, Wis.-A judge on Thursday temporarily blocked Wisconsin Republicans' contentious lame-duck laws limiting the powers of new Democratic Gov. Tony Evers, who immediately used his restored authority to pull the state out of a multistate challenge to the Affordable Care Act.

title: It's Baby Artichoke Time. Here's What They Were Made to Do.
summary: Tender baby artichokes and a creamy celery-root mash bake quickly under a pastry crust in this simple springtime recipe from London's Marksman Public House. TOM HARRIS HAS firm ideas on the proper cooking of artichokes. "If you put whole lemon in the cooking liquor, they taste of the rind," he said. "We don't want any of that rubbish. We want the flavor to be clean."

title: Dollar Rebounds on Europe Worries
summary: Concerns over weakening global economy highlight appeal of U.S. assets. The dollar rose Thursday, as worries over economic growth in the U.K. and Europe highlighted the appeal of U.S. assets a day after the Federal Reserve indicated it will hold interest rates steady this year.

title: Startup Marqeta Rides Investor Enthusiasm for Payments
summary: Fintech company, meant to rival bigger firms like FIS, is close to securing new fundraising. Payments startup Marqeta Inc. is in advanced talks with investors to raise hundreds of millions of dollars in additional funds at a valuation of roughly $2 billion, according to people familiar with the deal.

title: NFL Paid Under $10 Million to Settle Colin Kaepernick Grievance
summary: The league resolved collusion grievances with the former 49ers quarterback and Eric Reid, who led player protests during the national anthem, last month. Colin Kaepernick and Eric Reid, the NFL stars who alleged the league's teams colluded to keep them off the field after they led protests during the national anthem, will receive less than $10 million to settle grievances with the league, according to people briefed on the deal.

title: Sex, Bribes and K-Pop: A Scandal Takes Center Stage in South Korea
summary: Leaked celebrity chat messages lead to police investigations and a bout of national soul-searching. SEOUL-It is a scandal dipped in everything that has made South Korea globally chic over the past decade: K-pop, golf, smartphones and Gangnam.

title: New Hope for Fertility of Young Cancer Patients
summary: Procedure's success in monkeys is potential breakthrough for boys undergoing cancer treatment.

title: Boeing Defends 737 MAX Design Process, Expects Software Fix in Weeks
summary: The plane maker is updating the jetliner's flight-control system. A senior Boeing Co. executive defended the company's aircraft design and production processes following two fatal crashes of its 737 MAX airliner, and said fixes to software linked to at least one of those crashes should be ready within weeks.

title: House Democrats Probe White House Officials' Email Use
summary: The House Oversight Committee said it had evidence that officials, including Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump, used personal email accounts and messaging applications. WASHINGTON-The House Oversight Committee on Thursday said it had obtained evidence that White House officials, including senior advisers Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump, used personal email accounts and messaging applications, a pattern the panel said appeared to violate laws governing White House records.

title: Croquet is the New New Golf
summary: Resume Subscription. Every Wednesday, Gene Young puts on his croquet-mallet-emblazoned polo and Lands' End shorts, grabs his titanium and graphite mallet made by his late mentor who taught him the finer points of the game, hops into his golf cart and arrives at the croquet lawn, less than a mile from his home, in time for weekly wine 'n wickets.

title: Croquet anyone?
summary: The ancient sport has gained a new following in luxury retirement communities across the southeast United States because it's easy on the knees and a cinch to learn. Plus, you can drink wine while you do it.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Going Home Again...to Retire
summary: Don and Tammy Steeples moved back to his hometown of Palco, Kan., when he retired. They were unprepared for the expenses that came with small town homeownership. Retirees and farmers have a lot in common. Both contend with fluctuating finances, acts of god, natural pests and aging equipment.

title: A Growing Problem in Real Estate: Too Many Too Big Houses
summary: Baby boomers and retirees built large, elaborate dream homes across the Sunbelt-only to find that few people want to buy them.. Large, high-end homes across the Sunbelt are sitting on the market, enduring deep price cuts to sell.

title: Treasury to Sell $244 Billion in Debt
summary: U.S. Treasury Department will auction next week $178 billion in new debt and $66 billion in previously sold debt. The U.S. Treasury Department will auction $244 billion in securities next week, comprising $178 billion in new debt and $66 billion in previously sold debt. Details (all with minimum denominations of $100):

title: Coast Guard Says It Took a Hit From Government Shutdown
summary: Lapse in funding for 35 days halted paychecks to troops, set back maintenance work. SAN DIEGO-The U.S. Coast Guard has yet to fully recover from the effects of the partial government shutdown, top officers said, underscoring the service's vulnerability to political fights in Washington despite its expanding mission.

title: Turn Your Phone Into a Polaroid Camera
summary: Those selfies just languishing on your smartphone? Help them escape with these pocket-size instant printers. IF YOU'VE GONE to any wedding or corporate party lately you've likely smiled in a photo booth or picked up an instant camera that's ready to spit out low-res keepsakes. Trendy bars, too, are encouraging tipsy, old-school shutterbugging. It's a cute thing to do, said Ben Walton, official photographer for the New York Knicks: "I think folks are slowly going back to enjoying tangible memories versus digital ones."

title: What Britain Taught Van Gogh
summary: As a young man, the Dutch painter was inspired by the country and its art. When Vincent van Gogh arrived in London at the age of 20, in 1873, he was an art dealer, not yet an artist. His painting career didn't begin until four years later, in the Netherlands. But "Van Gogh and Britain," which will be on view from March 27 to Aug. 11 at Tate Britain in London, shows that the almost three years he spent in England played an integral part in developing his themes and style as an artist. The new show features 50 oil paintings, watercolors and drawings by van Gogh from private and public collections, as well as roughly 50 works of art by British artists who inspired or were inspired by him. "It's very much an exhibition where we're hoping that people will see the way the different works of art talk to each other," says the lead curator, Carol Jacobi.

title: Conagra Spends to Boost Sales
summary: Company's results show food makers that invested in brand improvements are seeing progress. Conagra Brands Inc. said spending on promotions and improvements to its products lifted sales in the latest quarter, underscoring a gap between food makers that have invested in improving their appeal to customers and others that have lagged behind.

title: Conagra Starts to Thaw Out
summary: Investors are reassured by strong results that Conagra can digest Pinnacle Foods. Conagra Brands got the chilliest of receptions three months ago, and no wonder.

title: A Philosophy of Food as Medicine
summary: The idea that your diet should be tailored to your body's needs sounds high-tech, but it's been part of Chinese cooking for millennia. "Let food be your medicine," said the ancient Greek physician Hippocrates in the 4th century B.C. But he probably didn't envisage a world in which people would feel so anxious about their diets that they would get their DNA sampled before they decided what to eat. Companies like Nutrigenomix and DNAFit will now test a swab of your saliva for various DNA markers and send you a detailed report on what to consume in order to optimize health for your particular body. Have trouble metabolizing caffeine? Reduce your coffee intake. Don't digest dairy well? Cut out yogurt.

title: Walmart Builds a Secret Weapon to Battle Amazon for Retail's Future
summary: Resume Subscription. Epiphany Davis arrived at work in lower Manhattan on a recent morning, consulted her cellphone and set off by foot in search of products ordered via text message by wealthy New Yorkers.

summary: These properties in Florida, North Carolina and South Carolina were bought, or built, by retired couples moving on to their next chapter in life.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Stuffy Sport of 'Horse Ballet' Dumps Tchaikovsky for Beyoncé
summary: Resume Subscription. WELLINGTON, Fla.-The speakers boomed with the familiar lyrics of Journey, and the crowd roared in jubilation: "Don't stop believing...hold on to that feeling!"

title: Chinese Education Startup Puts Western Teachers on Notice
summary: VIPKid tries to balance politically sensitive topics as it seeks $500 million; talk of Taiwan, Tiananmen Square leads to terminated contracts. A Chinese education company backed by U.S. investors including Kobe Bryant is cracking down on how its Western teachers cover politically fraught topics.

title: 'Big Ass' Entrepreneur Agrees to Pay $20 Million for Malcolm Forbes Townhouse
summary: J. Carey Smith is in contract to purchase the longtime home of the late chairman and editor in chief of Forbes magazine.. A Manhattan townhouse owned for decades by the family of Malcolm Forbes, the late chairman and editor in chief of Forbes magazine, is in contract to sell to a Texas entrepreneur who made his name with "Big Ass Fans" and "Big Ass Lights."

title: Found: The Most Flattering Women's Jeans
summary: Curtis Sittenfeld, the author of 'Prep' and the recent short-story collection 'You Think It, I'll Say It,' on her unlikely obsession with NYDJ-an acronym for Not Your Daughter's Jeans. I RECENTLY MOVED to Minneapolis, and I often hide in my home, wearing layers of fleece and long underwear. Such is the life of a full-time writer. But when I change out of fleece and long underwear-when I meet a friend for lunch or go to get a haircut, when I fly somewhere on a plane-I change into one of my five pairs of NYDJ jeans, three of which are black and two of which are blue. In the summer, I wear the ankle-length ones.

title: Historic Do-Over Election in North Carolina Brings Out Bruising Politics
summary: Ten candidates are fighting to be GOP nominee, who would face lone Democrat in general election later this year. RALEIGH, N.C.-The do-over election for North Carolina's empty Ninth Congressional District seat is off to a contentious start, with accusations of misconduct followed by a threat of a lawsuit in the first official week of the campaign.

title: It's Casual Thursday at the NYSE
summary: The New York Stock Exchange relaxed its strict dress code for the IPO of Levi Strauss, but just for a day. Tradition dies hard, but money talks.

title: The Immortal Charm of Daffodils
summary: The humble flower has been a favorite symbol in myth and art since ancient times. On April 15, 1802, the poet William Wordsworth and his sister Dorothy were enjoying a spring walk through the hills and vales of the English Lake District when they came across a field of daffodils. Dorothy was so moved that she recorded the event in her journal, noting how the flowers "tossed and reeled and danced and seemed as if they verily laughed with the wind that blew upon them over the Lake." And William decided there was nothing for it but to write a poem, which he published in its final version in 1815. "I Wandered Lonely as a Cloud" is one of his most famous reflections on the power of nature: "For oft, when on my couch I lie/In vacant or in pensive mood,/They flash upon that inward eye/Which is the bliss of solitude;/And then my heart with pleasure fills,/And dances with the daffodils."

title: The Secrets (and Lies) of Miami Beach
summary: This Art Deco-themed walking tour reveals Miami Beach's seedy, seductive past-and present. Plus, the most evocative hotels, bars and restaurants. JAMES CUBBY has seen a lot. Moments into the historical walking excursion he leads for Art Deco Tours, Mr. Cubby disclosed-with a raised eyebrow underneath his brown fedora-his own history in the city. After decades as a nightlife writer in Miami Beach, he knows everything worth knowing, he implied, about the city's strange, seedy past. He'd cut his teeth in the feverish nightclubs of the 1980s, just a few years after Miami began turning around its reputation as a dilapidated, crime-ridden place. He'd lived through the gleeful excess of the '90s, when Gianni Versace converted a 1930s townhouse into an altar to extravagance, with whole rooms made out of seashells.

title: Facebook Left Up Video of New Zealand Shootings for an Hour
summary: The 17-minute broadcast started at around 1:33 p.m. A user flagged the post 12 minutes after it ended. Police alerted Facebook to the video at 2:29 p.m. The company took it down minutes later.. Facebook Inc. left a gruesome video of shootings at a New Zealand mosque up on its site for half an hour after a user brought it to the company's attention, a previously unreported delay that highlights the social media giant's difficulty in controlling violent content on its platform.

title: Team Sky Remains Cycling's Exception with Ineos Deal
summary: The sport's most dominant team will debut with its new sponsor in May after being purchased by British billionaire Jim Ratcliffe. PARIS-The most successful cycling team of its generation was sitting at dinner in Mallorca last winter when the news broke like an exploding tire. Team Sky's chief sponsor, which had spent more than a quarter billion dollars to help it win the Tour de France six times, would be pulling its support at the end of the 2019 season.

title: If You Plan on Retiring Soon, Take a Test Drive
summary: Columnist Glenn Ruffenach advises those retiring in a year or two to try out their planned budget and daily routines. I plan to retire in 2020. Any advice for a person a year or two out from retirement? What steps or tasks are more important than others?

title: The Great Lessons of the Great Escape
summary: World War II POWs tunneled under a German prison camp 75 years ago, and a legend of wartime valor was born. On March 24, 1944, dozens of malnourished, ragged Allied prisoners of war began crawling out of a 340-foot tunnel they had spent nine months digging under Stalag Luft III, a Nazi prison camp in Lower Silesia. Just three of the 76 escapees reached safety. All of the others were recaptured, and 50 of them were executed.

title: A Wealth Of History, A History Of Wealth
summary: Naples is packed with culture and neighborhoods boasting some of the priciest real estate in Florida.. The warm weather and white sand beaches are what draw people to Naples, in southwest Florida. The active, philanthropic community and access to sophisticated dining, shopping and culture are what keep them there. The city on the Gulf of Mexico, about a 45-minute drive from Fort Myers, is home to roughly 22,000 people (51.5% are over the age of 65), according to census data. The Naples Pier, built in 1888 and the only way people could get into town until the late 1920s, is like a village commons. Surrounding it is Old Naples, which has historic homes (the oldest was built in 1895) and two retail and restaurant areas, Third Street South and Fifth Avenue South. For residents interested in water access, the Port Royal area, on canals between Naples Bay and the Gulf, features large houses with their own docks. Naples is a golfing paradise, too, with about 70 golf communities.

title: Red Sox GM Dave Dombrowski Dishes on Baseball and His Brain Trust
summary: Top minds in baseball and sports leadership help guide the architect of the reigning World Series champs. President of baseball operations, Boston Red Sox

summary: With performance bad and investors fleeing, Mr. Ackman 'went activist' on Pershing Square. William Ackman, once an omnipresent rabble-rouser, is barely visible these days.

title: Freddie Mac Names Brickman to Succeed Layton as CEO
summary: Brickman will also join board of mortgage-finance giant. Freddie Mac on Thursday said Donald Layton will retire as chief executive on July 1 and will be succeeded by its current president, David Brickman.

title: Despite Rulings, Farmers Remain Loyal to Bayer's Roundup
summary: Bayer's premier herbicide is still the dominant treatment for U.S. crops because of its low cost and effectiveness. Farmers are standing by Bayer AG's Roundup herbicide despite rulings from two juries that the world's most widely used weedkiller caused cancer in plaintiffs.

title: Biogen's Blowup May Lift Smaller Biotechs
summary: The failure of Alzheimer's drug aducanumab is a nightmare for Biogen shareholders but may be good for smaller biotech stocks as it now is forced to address its pipeline. A sad day for Alzheimer's patients spilled over into the stock market as well.

summary: Resume Subscription. Give Oracle this much. When it comes to papering over a dry spell, the company doesn't skimp on paper.

summary: Biogen, Darden and Conagra are among the companies with shares expected to trade actively Thursday. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: Tencent Looks for Life Beyond Gaming
summary: China's gaming giant capped an annus horribilis with a dismal set of quarterly numbers Thursday. Last year was a dismal one for China's gaming giant Tencent. The worst is over, but 2019 will still bring plenty of challenges.

title: Global Box Office Dethroned by Home-Entertainment Spending
summary: Despite North America's record ticket sales, world-wide revenue for online offerings outpaced the box office for the first time in 2018. Global audiences spent more to watch online entertainment than they did on tickets to sit in movie theaters for the first time last year, according to data released by the Motion Picture Association of America.

title: House Republicans Now Unanimous in Opposing Abortion Rights
summary: Moderate wing's demise has some in GOP fearing alienation of women voters. WASHINGTON-The start of a new Democratic-led House this year also marked the end of an era, as the House Republican caucus now doesn't have a single lawmaker considered a supporter of abortion rights.

title: A Central Banking Domino Effect Is in Motion
summary: Policy U-turns from the Fed and ECB are cascading around the world. ZURICH-Abrupt changes in the policies of the world's largest central banks have rippled through smaller economies, leaving them with the prospect of low and even negative interest rates for years to come despite having mostly healthy economies.

title: U.S. Jobless Claims Declined in Mid-March
summary: Initial claims, a proxy for layoffs across the U.S., fell by 9,000 last week. WASHINGTON-The number of Americans filing applications for new unemployment benefits fell last week, showing the labor market's strength.

title: Social Ties Bind CEO, Directors at Victoria's Secret Parent
summary: Activist investor argues board lacks independence from CEO Leslie Wexner, who has run the company for more than five decades. For decades, Leslie Wexner has run the parent of Victoria's Secret with a close-knit group of directors. But amid scrutiny of the board's ties to the 81-year-old chief executive, the company is preparing to bring in some fresh blood.

title: Baseball's Worst Team Is Finally Joining the 21st Century
summary: During a 115-loss season in 2018, the Baltimore Orioles were far behind other teams in analytics. They are now taking steps to catch up.. SARASOTA, Fla.-Mike Elias, the new general manager of the Baltimore Orioles, understands the difficulty of reconstructing a baseball franchise from scratch. He joined the Houston Astros, pioneers of the full-blown-teardown-to-achieve-success model, at the beginning of their process, ultimately rising to the role of GM Jeff Luhnow's top deputy. He knows what it takes to transform a mess into a perennial contender.

title: New Harry Potter Game Will Apply Lessons of 'Pokémon Go'
summary: 'Harry Potter: Wizards Unite,' coming from Niantic Inc. and Warner Bros., is new attempt at getting augmented reality right. When Niantic Inc. launches "Harry Potter: Wizards Unite," founder and Chief Executive John Hanke will try to solve a problem that bedeviled the startup's previous augmented-reality game, "Pokémon Go." A lot of people turned off the augmented reality.

title: Thailand's Junta Leader Tries Something New: Democracy
summary: Sunday's election will determine if leader's brand of authoritarian rule will persist in Buddhist kingdom. NAKHON RATCHASIMA, Thailand-Five years after a coup swept him to power, Thailand's junta leader Prayuth Chan-ocha is homing in on his most difficult mission yet: getting elected.

title: Painstaking Progress for Funds That Aim to Do Good
summary: A large fund launch signals increased investor interest in socially responsible ETFs. DWS Group Inc., the asset-management business of Deutsche Bank AG , recently raised $843 million in a single day for a new fund that tries to invest in the best corporate citizens in the U.S.

title: U.K. Requests Three-Month Brexit Extension
summary: Request comes a day before EU leaders are set to convene for a summit to discuss Britain's departure. The U.K. asked the European Union to delay its departure from the bloc until June 30, but EU leaders are likely to grant such a short extension only if British Prime Minister Theresa May can win backing next week from the U.K. Parliament for her Brexit deal.

title: New Zealand Models Guns Clampdown on Australian Experience
summary: Australia introduced tighter gun laws after a 1996 massacre. New Zealand's plan to ban military-style semiautomatic and assault weapons in response to a terrorist attack on two mosques mirrors tighter gun laws that neighboring Australia introduced after a 1996 massacre.

title: The Fed's New 'Normal' Looks Worrisome
summary: Maintaining solid growth and low inflation is requiring the pursuit of a very expansive monetary policy. The Federal Reserve now believes its monetary policy is back to normal. That should worry you: if this is normal, then the Fed has precious little ammunition for when economic conditions again turn abnormal.

title: Beware the Fed's Feedback Loop in Emerging Markets
summary: Many countries' economies look healthier because of volatile investment flows, not real economic progress. The Federal Reserve's shift away from raising interest rates has once again driven investors toward juicy returns in emerging markets. They need to be careful of a dangerous feedback loop: The very fact that money flows into these countries makes them look safer.

title: Trump Signals U.S. to Keep Tariffs on China After Deal
summary: U.S. has levied tariffs on $250 billion of Chinese goods. WASHINGTON-With the U.S. and China preparing for a fresh round of face-to-face negotiations, President Trump said the U.S. expected to keep tariffs on Chinese goods in place for a "substantial period of time," even after a deal.

title: New Zealand to Impose Sweeping Gun Ban After Mosque Killings
summary: Government will pay cash to those who surrender their weapons in a nationwide amnesty. New Zealand moved to ban military-style semiautomatic weapons, assault rifles and high-capacity magazines, stepping up its response to Friday's slaughter of 50 worshipers at two Christchurch mosques by a lone gunman.

summary: Website known for behavior banned by mainstream platforms was chosen by mosque shooter to announce his deadly plan. Fredrick Brennan founded the website 8chan more than five years ago as a no-holds-barred bastion of unconstrained speech devoted to critiquing what he saw as the authoritarianism of leftist culture and politics.

summary: Authorities take down once-bustling Uighur neighborhoods to create a compliant economic hub. URUMQI, China-In this old Silk Road city in western China, a state security campaign involving the detention of vast numbers of people has moved to its next stage: demolishing their neighborhoods and purging their culture.

title: Trump to Issue Order Tying Federal Grants to Free Speech on Campus
summary: Moves follows complaints that conservative speakers are stifled. WASHINGTON-President Trump is expected to issue an executive order Thursday directing federal agencies to tie research and education grants made to colleges and universities to more aggressive enforcement of the First Amendment, according to a draft of the order viewed by The Wall Street Journal.

title: Oaktree Capital Expresses Confidence in Digital First's Bid for Gannett
summary: USA Today publisher had questioned hedge fund's ability to fund the $1.4 billion takeover offer. Digital First Media took a step forward in its hostile bid for Gannett Co. , with a debt specialist indicating Digital First could raise the funds needed to pay for the $1.4 billion takeover.
